Decaf Editor API

Uses of Package
org.hs.jfc

Packages that use org.hs.jfc
com.bitwise.decaf.editor This package contains the foundation of the Decaf editor, including all user interface components for code constructs up to but excluding the contents of method bodies (those are found in the grammar package). 
com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar This package contains the user interface foundation for the contents of method bodies. 
org.hs.jfc This package contains alternatives to some of the cumbersome facilities of the JFC. 
 

Classes in org.hs.jfc used by com.bitwise.decaf.editor
FormPanel
          This convenient class is just a JPanel with FormLayout as its default layout manager.
HotComponent
          Welcome to HotComponent, a new alternative to drag-and-drop that is substantially less processor intensive, allows free use of the mouse during the object association process, and offers a much more concise and reliable API.
HotComponent.Arbiter
          The Arbiter pays a visit to your component upon registration with the HotStation, in the callback method register(Arbiter).
 

Classes in org.hs.jfc used by com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar

          This convenient class is just a JPanel with FormLayout as its default layout manager.
HotComponent
          Welcome to HotComponent, a new alternative to drag-and-drop that is substantially less processor intensive, allows free use of the mouse during the object association process, and offers a much more concise and reliable API.

          The Arbiter pays a visit to your component upon registration with the HotStation, in the callback method register(Arbiter).
 

Classes in org.hs.jfc used by org.hs.jfc
CursorCenter.Descriptor
          Describes a colorizable java.awt.Cursor with its image file (which must be in standard .gif format: funny compressions don't work), the color of the transparent regions, and the color of the colorizable regions.
HotComponent
          Welcome to HotComponent, a new alternative to drag-and-drop that is substantially less processor intensive, allows free use of the mouse during the object association process, and offers a much more concise and reliable API.
HotComponent.Arbiter
          The Arbiter pays a visit to your component upon registration with the HotStation, in the callback method register(Arbiter).
